articles.title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
articles.description:
Dressed in black and using a wheelchair, Clancy addressed the court only once during the brief proceedings.

The post Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court on February 20 for her first in-person hearing.
Clancy, dressed in black and using a wheelchair, addressed the court briefly.
The case continues to raise concerns about mental health support in Boston.

articles.title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
articles.description:
The Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved the measure, which now heads to Beacon Hill and could raise $60 million annually for housing.

The post Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Barnstable County approved a transfer fee on homes sold for over $1 million.
The measure could generate $60 million annually for affordable housing initiatives.
Funds will support housing solutions benefiting Cape Cod and potentially Boston residents.

articles.title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
articles.description:
The takeover was scheduled at 3 p.m. Friday and would be monitored for public safety, police said.

The post Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Peabody police issued a warning about a planned takeover at Northshore Mall.
The event is scheduled for 3 p.m. on Friday, monitored for safety.
Local residents should remain vigilant due to potential disruptions at the mall.

articles.title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
articles.description:
Federal authorities say eight defendants are in custody after investigators seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and tens of thousands in cash across Eastern Massachusetts.

The post 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Federal authorities arrested eight members of the Harvard Street Gang on drug and firearms charges.
Investigators seized 25 firearms and kilograms of drugs across Eastern Massachusetts.
Local residents may experience reduced gang-related violence and drug activity in the area.

articles.title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
articles.description:
Horford said he would share more details later before adding that he felt it was time for him to go elsewhere.

The post Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Al Horford announced his departure from the Celtics, citing personal reasons beyond basketball.
Horford plans to provide more details about his decision in the future.
His exit may impact the Celtics' roster dynamics and fan expectations for the upcoming season.

articles.title: Readers agree: Build a new Madison Park to benefit Boston’s youth
articles.description:
As the city reconsiders development of the long-empty parcel, Boston.com readers argue that rebuilding Madison Park would be a tangible public good.

The post Readers agree: Build a new Madison Park to benefit Boston’s youth appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston.com readers support rebuilding Madison Park for community benefit.
The long-empty parcel has been under consideration for development since February 2026.
Revitalizing Madison Park could provide essential recreational space for Boston's youth.

articles.title: Planned Parenthood rolls out vasectomies at Mass. health centers
articles.description:
A playful Valentine’s Day announcement unveiled the long-requested service.

The post Planned Parenthood rolls out vasectomies at Mass. health centers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Planned Parenthood begins offering vasectomies at Massachusetts health centers starting February 14, 2026.
This service addresses long-standing requests from local communities for male reproductive health options.
Boston residents gain increased access to affordable and safe vasectomy procedures in their area.
